title: IV Colombia-European Union Forum 2023: Advancing Digital, Green, and Social Transitions
executive_summary: The IV Colombia-European Union Forum, held in Bogotá on March 15-16, 2023, focused on enhancing cooperation and investment for Colombia's sustainable transformation in line with the EU's Global Gateway strategy. Key objectives included promoting a triple transition—digital, green, and social—while fostering public-private partnerships. Discussions highlighted the need for resilient connectivity, digital transformation initiatives, and renewable energy investments. High-level participants included EU officials and Colombian leaders, who affirmed a shared agenda under the EU-LAC Digital Alliance. Outcomes included commitments to accelerate 5G expansion, align on green-energy projects, and develop a pipeline of projects for EU funding. Next steps involve intensifying skills programs and monitoring progress for future EU-LAC dialogues in 2024.
characteristics: The forum focused on enhancing EU-Colombia cooperation for sustainable transformation, aligning with the EU's Global Gateway strategy.
Key discussions included digital infrastructure, renewable energy investments, and skills training for inclusive growth.
High-level participants included EU and Colombian leaders, emphasizing public-private collaboration.
Outcomes included commitments to accelerate digital connectivity and green energy projects, with plans for future monitoring and reporting.
practical_applications: Implementation of Colombia's 'ConectaTIC 360' roadmap for digital transformation.
Development of Spain's 'España Digital 2026' plan, which aligns with Colombia's digital initiatives.
Ongoing collaboration on renewable-energy projects and climate-finance avenues under the Global Gateway strategy.
Establishment of a pipeline for flagship connectivity and renewable-energy projects eligible for EU funding instruments.
Intensification of skills programs and digital-innovation hubs targeting rural and vulnerable populations.
Commitment to monitor implementation and report progress at the upcoming EU-LAC ministerial dialogues in 2024.
commitments: Showcase progress during Spain's EU Council Presidency in H2 2023.
Monitor implementation and report at forthcoming EU-LAC ministerial dialogues in 2024.

commitment_details.text: Showcase progress during Spain's EU Council Presidency in H2 2023.
Monitor implementation and report at forthcoming EU-LAC ministerial dialogues in 2024.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Accelerated spectrum renewal and innovative business models to expand 5G and fibre networks.
kpi_list.target_description: Accelerate spectrum renewal and develop innovative business models.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Progress evaluation through project reports and stakeholder feedback.
kpi_list.responsible_entity: Telecommunications authorities and private sector partners

kpi_list.kpi_text: Consolidate a pipeline of flagship connectivity & renewable-energy projects eligible for EU funding instruments.
kpi_list.target_description: Create a pipeline of projects for EU funding eligibility.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Review of project proposals and funding applications.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Intensify skills programmes and digital-innovation hubs focusing on rural and vulnerable populations.
kpi_list.target_description: Enhance skills training and innovation hubs for targeted populations.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Monitoring participation and outcomes of training programs.
kpi_list.responsible_entity: Ministry of ICT and educational institutions

kpi_list.kpi_text: Monitor implementation and report at forthcoming EU-LAC ministerial dialogues in 2024.
kpi_list.target_description: Track progress and report findings at ministerial dialogues.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Documentation of progress reports and dialogue outcomes.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Showcase progress during Spain's EU Council Presidency (H2 2023).
kpi_list.target_description: Demonstrate advancements in projects during the EU Council Presidency.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Presentation and feedback during the EU Council meetings.

sdg_alignment: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

top_actors.name: Gustavo Petro
top_actors.justification: As the President of Colombia, Gustavo Petro plays a crucial role in the discussions and decisions regarding Colombia's partnership with the EU, particularly in the context of the Global Gateway strategy and the triple transition.

top_actors.name: Margrethe Vestager
top_actors.justification: As the Executive Vice-President of the European Commission, Margrethe Vestager is a key figure in EU policy-making and her involvement signifies the importance of EU support for Colombia's digital and green transitions.

top_actors.name: Euroamérica Foundation
top_actors.justification: The Euroamérica Foundation organized the forum, making it central to the discussions and initiatives aimed at fostering EU-Colombia cooperation and investment.

top_themes.name: EU-LAC Digital Alliance
top_themes.justification: This theme is central to the document as it highlights the partnership between the EU and Colombia, which is the main focus of the forum. It aligns with the objectives of promoting cooperation and mobilizing investments.

top_themes.name: Digital Infrastructure (Digital Transformation & Strategy)
top_themes.justification: Digital infrastructure is a key topic discussed in the forum, emphasizing the need for scaling digital projects. It is crucial for achieving the digital transition and is directly linked to the commitments made during the forum.

top_themes.name: Digital Skills Development (Digital Transformation & Strategy)
top_themes.justification: The development of digital skills is essential for inclusive growth and productivity, making it a significant theme. It supports the objectives of fostering public-private collaboration and addressing the needs of vulnerable populations.
